primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God acts through 'nobodies' and simple means to heal the incurable 'leprosy' (sin/death) of an outsider, demonstrating His absolute sovereignty and freedom from human expectations.

tekstueel_bewijs: The God who is really God is able to do anything he wishes
The God who can kill and make alive has given life
He reaches beyond us and brings an outsider like Naaman into his fold
He would cure him of his leprosy
His flesh was restored like the flesh of a little child
God shows his love not by overwhelming us... but rather by coming alongside us
He brings an outsider like Naaman into his fold
There is a little slave girl somewhere in your life, bearing a word of hope

helper.identificatie: The 'Nobodies' (Slave girl, Elisha, Servants, Sacramental elements)
tekstueel_bewijs: A prepubescent female, a foreigner, a slave, a nobody speaks a word of hope
Naaman turned and went away in a rage
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Leprosy is explicitly defined as a metaphor for 'guilt, sin, and death,' which are humanly incurable.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer must 'wash' or 'listen' to the word of hope brought by the 'nobodies' in their life.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action (washing) is a response to the divine initiative already present in the prophet's word.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is, as always, one step ahead of us with his grace.
The God who can kill and make alive has given life.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Naaman was a mighty man of valor.
He went down and dipped himself.
You can’t lose anything just by trying.

voorbeelden: Naaman regarded it as Elisha’s duty to come out.
The king of Syria wants his general healthy.
We do not want to believe that God shows preferential treatment.
Now I know that there is no God in all the earth except in Israel.
The God who is really God is able to do anything he wishes.
Only God has ultimate power over creation.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) in the face of human 'In-pouvoir' (Impotence regarding sin/death).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Leprosy) through ~S1 (Kings/Money) to ~S2 (Slave girl's word) and finally S1 (God's healing).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Grace is resolved not by human effort but by God's choice to use 'low' things to shame the 'high'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; leprosy is treated as a metaphor for ontological hopelessness.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently positions God as the primary actor who initiates healing for an undeserving enemy through means that offend human pride.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You can’t lose anything just by trying, right?

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God is, as always, one step ahead of us with his grace.
Leprosy is a metaphor for all that is diseased and wrong in human life... for all that is hopeless.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Naaman is not presented as a hero to follow, but as a recipient of a grace that offended him.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God saves the Syrian enemy to show His own freedom.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and humility; realization of one's own 'but' (leprosy) and God's unmerited favor.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is of the Lord.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative of Naaman is perfectly integrated with the theological claim of God's radical freedom.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Coming alongside us with water, and bread, and wine.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The word of the prophet functions as the external endowment of power.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; described as a 'musty, faintly sickening odor' in even the best lives.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject, Grace is the Object, and the 'nobodies' are the Helpers.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God heals Naaman) correctly precedes and enables the response.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids the trap of moralism by making the 'washing' an act of surrender to a power already at work, rather than a condition to earn it.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'but' hook; Greimas reveals that the 'but' is the Opponent that only a Divine Subject can overcome.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Syrian context; Greimas explains why the slave girl is structurally necessary as the 'Helper' of the Divine Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'kings' are false Subjects who lack the 'Pouvoir' to achieve the 'Object' (healing).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Rutledge Rule' effectively by making God the subject of the most critical verbs of transformation.
